intro: Tetraplasandra lanaiensis, commonly known as the Lanai beauty, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are white to pinkish in color. Tetraplasandra lanaiensis is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in forested areas.
